posts.title: Northwest Arkansas Schools Promote Biking At All Ages
posts.content:
NW Arkansas continues to emphasize cycling throughout the community by partnering with schools to teach the benefits of biking for recreation, transportation, and developing mechanical skills. 

  • Start them young: People for Bikes recently highlighted NWA’s cycling community and the work being done to bring the benefits of biking to youth through school programs. 
  • Training wheels: Schools have incorporated elementary and middle school programs like All Kids Bike and Outride, and high school students can choose cycling as an outdoor education elective. 

Read the full article on People for Bikes HERE.

posts.title: Find Locally Crafted Goods At The NWA Makers Market
posts.content:
Hundreds of local craftsmen will set up shop with their goods during the NWA Makers Market this Sunday, Nov 6 at Washington County Fairgrounds. 

  • Ultimately local: From unique art to handmade furniture, everything at the Makers Market is made in NWA by people from NWA. 
  • So you know: There will be local coffee and food trucks at the event from 10a-5p. Parking on-site will cost $5. 

Invite your friends to the event HERE.

posts.title: End Your Halloween In Fayetteville’s Lower Ramble
posts.content:
Enjoy the fading fall colors under the canopy in the Lower Ramble and end your Halloween season with some outdoor fun. 

  • Treats in the trees: Put on your costumes and trick-or-treat the trail tonight from 4-6:30p in the Fay Jones Woods.
  • Pretty lil pumpkin: Give your jack-o-lantern one last chance to be admired in the Pumpkin Pageant on Wed, Nov 2 from 5-6:30p. Pumpkins can be left behind to be collected for composting. 

Find more about the event HERE.

posts.title: New Trailside Bar And Restaurant Opens In Bentonville
posts.content:
A new bar and restaurant called The Bend just opened right off the Razorback Greenway in North Bentonville. 

  • Order up: The trailside patio pub menu offers sandwiches, flatbreads, salads, light snacks, and a selection of local brews. 
  • Peddle up: Located at 3604 Frontage Rd in Bentonville, the bar can be found between mile markers 38 and 39 on the Razorback Greenway near Buddy Pegs Bike Shop.

Check out The Bend online HERE.

posts.title: New Public Exhibit On Display At The Momentary
posts.content:
The Momentary has a new art exhibition on display by Chicago artist, Yvette Mayorga, entitled What a Time to be. 

  • Pink frosting: In her signature pink and frosted style, Mayorga’s exhibit combines images of family, found objects, 90s nostalgia, and moments from Midwest life. 
  • What a time to be: The exhibition’s title speaks to both the privileges and upheavals that have come with life in the contemporary age. 

The exhibit is free to the public until May 2023. Learn more HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Calling all women: Accelerate your business goals and dreams by joining the 2023 EMPOWER Cohort offered by Startup Junkie and Science Venture Studio.* 
  • Ghouls in Gravette: Trick-or-treat Main St in Gravette tonight from 4-7p. 
  • Radiation station: UAMS installed its Proton Center cyclotron last week, advancing the range of cancer treatment available in Arkansas. 
  • Last call: Don’t miss the last of the Halloween celebrations happening in Fayetteville this week.
  • Sugar rush: Gobble up some treats during the Goblin Candy Crawl tonight in Downtown Rogers from 3:30-5:30p. 
  • Tell it: Have a story? We have room in the newsletter for you! Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
